byline.contributor: Motoko Rich and Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo.

abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe joins Pres Obama at site of 1941 Pearl Harbor attack and offers condolences for those who lost their lives in Japanese assault, but stops short of apology; ceremony forms chapter in process of reconciliation between countries and mirrors Pres Obama's May visit to Hiroshima.

headline.print_headline: In Visit to Pearl Harbor, Japanese Leader Pays Tribute to Victims of War
headline.main: Japanese Leader Offers Condolences in Visit to Pearl Harbor

snippet: Joining President Obama at the site of the attack that drew the United States into World War II, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said, “We must never repeat the horrors of war again.”...
lead_paragraph: Joining President Obama at the site of the attack that drew the United States into World War II, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said, “We must never repeat the horrors of war again.”
